repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
fixes #24395

need a better error message and trying to figure out how to reproduce in a test case.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -40,6 +40,20 @@ describe('startup', function()
     ok(string.find(alter_slashes(meths.get_option_value('runtimepath', {})), funcs.stdpath('config'), 1, true) == nil)
   end)
 
+  it('prevents infinite loop', function()
+    clear()
+    local screen
+    screen = Screen.new(60, 2)
+    screen:attach()
+    funcs.termopen({ nvim_prog })

comment_data.body: that works, any idea for a better error message?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -40,6 +40,20 @@ describe('startup', function()
     ok(string.find(alter_slashes(meths.get_option_value('runtimepath', {})), funcs.stdpath('config'), 1, true) == nil)
   end)
 
+  it('prevents infinite loop', function()
+    clear()
+    local screen
+    screen = Screen.new(60, 2)
+    screen:attach()
+    funcs.termopen({ nvim_prog })

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
      os_errmsg("Nvim child UI cannot attach to the UI of its parent ($NVIM)");
```

That's good enough for now. Later we can assign a `EXX` number and add a help tag.

`strequal` is a fragile way to check if the server is the same. But it probably catches most accidents.

Ideally we could check some sort of server identifier. https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/1758 would be an obvious way, but until then another way is to check the parent of `tempname()`. 

But that also has some tricky questions to answer, so let's save it for later.
i'm not very familiar with the codebase, why is strequal fragile?
Because different forms of a server address may resolve to the same server. For example `/foo//bar` is the same server as `/foo/bar` , yet `strequal()` thinks they are different.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -40,6 +40,19 @@ describe('startup', function()
     ok(string.find(alter_slashes(meths.get_option_value('runtimepath', {})), funcs.stdpath('config'), 1, true) == nil)
   end)
 
+  it('prevents infinite loop', function()
+    clear({ "-u", "NONE" })

@@ -40,6 +40,19 @@ describe('startup', function()
     ok(string.find(alter_slashes(meths.get_option_value('runtimepath', {})), funcs.stdpath('config'), 1, true) == nil)
   end)
 
+  it('prevents infinite loop', function()
+    clear({ '-u', 'NONE' })
+    local screen
+    screen = Screen.new(60, 3)
+    screen:attach()
+    command("terminal " .. nvim_prog .. " -u NONE --server $NVIM --remote-ui")

comment_data.body:
Default argv for `clear()` already contains `-u NONE`
```suggestion
    clear()
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -40,6 +40,19 @@ describe('startup', function()
     ok(string.find(alter_slashes(meths.get_option_value('runtimepath', {})), funcs.stdpath('config'), 1, true) == nil)
   end)
 
+  it('prevents infinite loop', function()
+    clear({ '-u', 'NONE' })

comment_data.body:
This doesn't work with powershell or cmd.exe. I think this should work:
```suggestion
    funcs.termopen({ nvim_prog, '-u', 'NONE', '--server', eval('v:servername'), '--remote-ui' })
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -40,6 +40,19 @@ describe('startup', function()
     ok(string.find(alter_slashes(meths.get_option_value('runtimepath', {})), funcs.stdpath('config'), 1, true) == nil)
   end)
 
+  it('prevents infinite loop', function()
+    clear({ '-u', 'NONE' })
+    local screen
+    screen = Screen.new(60, 3)
+    screen:attach()
+    command('terminal ' .. nvim_prog .. ' -u NONE --server $NVIM --remote-ui')

comment_data.body:
Lint failure because this message is too long.
Also should this message be translated? @justinmk

comment_regular_data.body: This needs to be properly documented. There is nothing wrong with a GUI being launched a child process, including launching a terminal emulator with a TUI process (which is to be seen as a GUI like any other). And then it should be clear that unsettling NVIM is something you are expected to do. (In theory we could detect a different pty being used..)
Yes, a crude check is better than nothing, but it should be documented what the real intention is so you know when it is safe to circumvent it.
where should it be documented? error message, comment?
should i merge all the commits into one or how does this work?

title: feat(remote): avoid --remote-ui infinite loop
